intro: January is a great time to start planning what vegetable varieties will be grown in the garden.

variant.title: ONIONS
variant.info: Late January is a great time to start your onion seeds indoors if you live in a warmer gardening zone (6-10) For zones 1-5 start your onion seeds in mid-late February

variant.title: HERBS
variant.info: Herbs are defiantly the most popular indoor plant to grow throughout the winter months

intro: Get your garden planning started. In some warmer locations you can begin sowing your vegetable seeds outdoors.

variant.title: BROCCOLI
variant.info: If you live in a warmer climate and can find a quick growing Broccoli variety you can harvest until it bolts in the hot summer sun!

variant.title: LETTUCE
variant.info: Start a crop of salad mix greens that gets bright sun but not all day.

intro: March is the perfect time to get those tomato and pepper seeds started indoors ready for an early spring planting!

variant.title: BEETS
variant.info: Sow beets now for a fast, early summer treat

variant.title: CABBAGE
variant.info: Cabbage is one of the easier plants to grow in the garden. Select a variety that is right for your location (size and maturity length).

intro: Yes, Yes, Yes! April is finally here and your garden soil is finally warming up.

variant.title: BEANS
variant.info: Start planting both bush and pole beans now that the soil and air are warmed up.

variant.title: CARROTS
variant.info: Planting carrots by April will give an early summer crop.

intro: Finally warm temperatures are here to stay and you don’t have to worry about that frost.

variant.title: CORN
variant.info: One of the most rewarding and fast growing crops to grow.

variant.title: CUCUMBERS
variant.info: Fast growing vine or bush cucumber plants can produce an abundance of cucumber fruits.

intro: Most fruiting plants like tomatoes, peppers, and eggplants should already be in the ground.

variant.title: HERBS
variant.info: Plant heat loving herbs like basil, oregano, thyme and sage.

variant.title: MELONS
variant.info: Melons are some of the most rewarding plants to grow. Great for hot, long summers.

intro: There are still some great crops that can be planted that will keep your garden pumping

variant.title: BROCCOLI
variant.info: Broccoli can be planted in the fall to produce a crop well into November.

variant.title: CARROTS
variant.info: Planting carrots by mid-July yields a fall crop that will keep in the garden until used.

intro: August is an ideal time to plant seeds for a second gardening season

variant.title: BEANS
variant.info: Start planting both bush and pole beans now that the soil and air are warmed up.

variant.title: COVER CROPS
variant.info: A great way to add nutrients to your soil for the following year is by growing winter cover crops this fall.

intro: Although September marks the beginning of fall, there are still a few fast growing vegetables that can be planted this month

variant.title: BLUEBERRIES
variant.info: Fall is the perfect time to plant blueberry plants.

variant.title: GARLIC
variant.info: Garlic is a vegetable that can be planted in the fall for a larger and earlier harvest this coming spring.

intro: Fall is here and many vegetables don’t have enough time to develop before your first frost.

variant.title: FLOWER BULBS
variant.info: October is a great time to plant those fall flower bulbs.

variant.title: HERBS
variant.info: Herbs are defiantly the most popular indoor plant to grow throughout the winter months.

intro: Don’t be sad, you can still grow a lot of different plants inside.

variant.title: SPROUTS
variant.info: Growing sprouts indoors is fun, quick and a great way to spruce up salads and sandwiches.

variant.title: INDOOR PLANTS
variant.info: Growing flowers indoors can be a good way to pass the winter months. Try growing an indoor Amaryllis flower kit.

intro: It’s time for the garden seed catalogs to arrive! Start planning your garden wherever you live.

variant.title: HERBS
variant.info: Herbs are defiantly the most popular indoor plant to grow throughout the winter months.

variant.title: VEGETABLES
variant.info: If you live in some warmer climates it is a perfect time to plant vegetables.
